intro: Gonolobus hadrostemma, commonly known as the hairy leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it both a popular garden plant and a potential weed.
